title: What outliers are
text: Outliers are data points that lie far from the overall pattern. Even one extreme value can greatly change the correlation. When you graph an outlier, it will appear not to fit the pattern of the graph. Some outliers are due to actual mistakes (for example, writing down $$50$$ instead of 500) while others may indicate that something unusual is happening. While outliers or extreme points may be errors or some kind of abnormality, they may also be a key to understanding the data.

choices: Yes, because removing it caused a large drop in the correlation
No, because outliers never affect correlations
No, the outlier made the results more accurate

title: Research practice

choices: Whether outliers are present and how they might affect the correlation
Whether the correlation value is above $$0.90$$
Whether the sample size is exactly $$100$$
Whether the variables are measured in dollars or years
